intro: Petrorhagia alpina, commonly known as the Alpine rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features woody stems and small, fleshy leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and numerous stamens, blooming in late spring to early summer. Petrorhagia alpina thrives in rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes.
